Today we are going to be looking at problem and solution texts. Problem solution texts can be difficult to work through. There can be multiple problems and solutions, or one problem and one solution. Some even have one problem and you have to decide the solution based on what is happening around you. Check out the example. See if you can figure out the problem.
Item.speech: Today, we are going to be looking at problem and solution texts. Problem solution texts can be difficult to work through. There can be multiple problems and solutions, or one problem and one solution. Some even have one problem and you have to decide the solution based on what is happening around you. Check out the example. See if you can figure out the problem.

Item.text: OK, let me think about it. So the problem is that Jill thinks she is sick?

Item.speech: That's right. Then, we read the rest of the example and we can see that the solution is that Jill gets a prescription for medication.

Item.text: I think that makes sense. I'm sure we will get plenty of practice. Are there a lot of texts today?

Today we will look at two texts, but we encounter problem solution texts all the time. They could be blog posts, articles in the newspaper or in magazines, or pamphlet at the doctor. There are all kinds of them, even if we don't realize it.
Item.speech: Today, we will look at two texts, but we encounter problem solution texts all the time. They could be blog posts, articles in the newspaper or in magazines, or pamflets at the doctor. There are all kinds of them, even if we don't realize it.

Question.text: _user_, which of the highlighted sentences helps solve the problem? press on the sentence.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Cover the burn with a sterile gauze bandage is a solution because it is an action that contributes to solving the problem.

Answer.name: Incorrect
Answer.text: The sentence telling us what over the counter means is a definition, not a solution. The sentence, protecting the burn is important, does not actually tell us how to protect the burn, and so it cannot be a solution. The instruction, cover the burn with a sterile gauze bandage, tells us how to help heal the burn, and so it is a solution.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect2

Question.text: _user_, why is it important to cool a minor burn?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: You cool the burn in order to relieve pain. The cool water can help the burning sensation feel less painful.

Answer.name: Incorrect
Answer.text: The writer does not talk about how cooling the burn can prevent scarring or infections. The correct answer is, to relieve pain.

Answer.name: JordanTurn
Answer.text: Jordan, what do you think about this explanation?

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: It's to relieve pain.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect1
Answer.text: It's to prevent scarring.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect2
Answer.text: It's to prevent infections.

Question.text: Could hot water be used as a treatment?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is, no; cool, not hot water will help the pain.
Answer.speech: The correct answer is, no. Cool, not hot water will help the pain.

Answer.name: Incorrect
Answer.text: This text does not talk about disinfecting the wound. It only talks about the body getting too cold in relation to ice, not cool water. Also, the text never says anything about using hot water on the burn. The correct answer is, no, cool, not hot water will help the pain.
Answer.speech: This text does not talk about disinfecting the wound. It only talks about the body getting too cold in relation to ice, not cool water. Also, the text never says anything about using hot water on the burn. The correct answer is, no. Cool, not hot water will help the pain.

Answer.name: JordanTurn
Answer.text: Jordan, what do you think now?

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: It would increase the pain, so no, we shouldn't be using hot water as a treatment.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect1
Answer.text: I still think it's a good idea to use hot water for disinfecting purposes.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect2
Answer.text: Maybe hot water can also be used to keep the body from becoming too cold.

Question.text: _user_, I would like to know what you think. Why do you think it's important to bandage the burn?
Question.speech: _user_, I would like to know what you think. Why do you think it's important to bandage the burn?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Putting a bandage on the burn will keep the air off and the air or wind can make the burn sting.
Answer.speech: Putting a bandage on the burn will keep the air off, and the air, or wiend, can make the burn sting!

Answer.name: Incorrect
Answer.text: While you don't need a prescription to buy a bandage, this is not the reason you bandage a burn. The signs of infection are also not mentioned as reasons to bandage the burn. The correct answer is, it keeps air off the burn. The air or wind can make the burn sting, so you want to cover the burn to protect it.
Answer.speech: While you don't need a prescription to buy a bandage, this is not the reason you bandage a burn. The signs of infection are also not mentioned as reasons to bandage the burn. The correct answer is, it keeps air off the burn. The air, or wiend, can make the burn sting! So you want to cover the burn to protect it.

Answer.text: Jordan, I would like to know your answer as well.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: It's to keep air off the burn.
Answer.speech: It's to keep, air, off the burn.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect2

Question.text: _user_, what does the text say to do if there is swelling or oozing at the burn site?
Question.speech: _user_, what does the text say to do if there is swelling or oozing at the burn site?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: If there is swelling and oozing at the burn site, you should seek medical help. These are signs of an infection to the wound, and can be very serious.

Answer.name: Incorrect
Answer.text: Creams can make infection worse, and bandaging will not help treat infections. If there is swelling or oozing at the burn site, you should immediately seek medical help.
Answer.speech: Creams can make infection worse, and bandijing will not help treat infections. If there is swelling or oozing at the burn site, you should immediately seek medical help

Answer.text: Jordan, what do you think we should do?

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I would go seek medical help immediately.

Answer.speech: Don't we just use bandages again? I guess we would need to stairilize it this time.

Answer.speech: I think using egg whites, butter, or, ointments, is a good idea.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect2

Question.text: _user_, if we are summarizing a problem and solutions text, what must be included in our summary?
Question.speech: _user_, If we are summorizing a problem and solutions text, what must be included in our summary?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: This isn't a trick question! Of course, as this is a problem and solutions text, the problem and the solutions presented in the text would be critical in your summary.

Answer.name: Incorrect
Answer.text: Problem and solution text summaries do not need to include characters, jokes, a plot, or a setting, but they must always have the problem and the solutions as discussed in the text.

Answer.name: JordanTurn
Answer.text: Jordan, if you were to write a summary for a problem and solutions text, what would you include?

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I would include the problem and the solutions, obviously.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect1
Answer.text: I want to include the plot and the setting.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect2
Answer.text: I want to include characters and jokes. That would make my summary more interesting to read.

Rule.name: Read
Rule.description: Wait for user to finish reading. To DoneReading

Rule.name: DoneReading
Rule.description: First readying page done. Next page. To PageLoaded

Rule.name: DoneReading2
Rule.description: Second reading page done. Next Page. To PageLoaded

Rule.name: NotDoneReading
Rule.description: Reading time out. Pump. To MoveOn

Rule.name: SystemMoveOn
Rule.description: Reading time out again. To PageLoaded

Rule.name: JordanAgreeUserCorrect
Rule.description: User correct. Jordan agree. Feedback. To GoBack

Rule.name: JordanDisagree1UserCorrect
Rule.description: User good. Jordan disagree. Feedback. To GoBack

Rule.name: JordanDisagree2UserCorrect
Rule.description: User good. Jordan disagree. Feedback. To GoBack

Rule.name: HasItem
Rule.description: Show item. Check agent. To AskQ (2)

Rule.name: GetTutoringPack1
Rule.description: Get medium level tutoring pack. To HasTutoringPack(2)

Rule.name: GetTutoringPackSecondLevel
Rule.description: Get hard level tutoring pack. To HasTutoringPack(2)

Rule.name: Continue
Rule.description: Load tutoring pack. Get item. To GetItem (2)
